title.native: 頭文字〈イニシャル〉D THIRD STAGE

description: Takumi is approached by RedSuns leader Ryosuke Takahashi and offered to join him in forming a professional racing team. Before coming up with an answer to the proposal, Takumi seeks retribution by issuing a rematch to Emperor leader Kyouichi Sudou, who previously defeated him due to an engine failure. He is also challenged by Kai Kogashiwa, a second-generation street racer whose father was once a fierce rival of Takumi's father Bunta.

alternative: Ryou Takashi (リョウ・タカハシ)

node.description:
Shuichi Shigeno is a Japanese manga artist famous for creating Initial D. Shigeno has also created Baribari Densetsu, Dopkan, and Tunnel Nuketara Sky Blue all prior to the manga that would make him famous in 1995. In 1985, he received the Kodansha Manga Award in shounen for Bari Bari Densetsu.

He owns a 1980s Toyota Sprinter Trueno with a panda white color scheme, like Initial D's main character Takumi. He also owns a Sonic Blue Mica-colored 1999 WRX Type STi Version 6 with an STi sports bumper (a part from the STi sport catalogue made to look like the 22B STi bumper but fits non-wide body Imprezas) just like Takumi's father, Bunta. One of his notable students is Jyoji Morikawa, creator of Hajime no Ippo.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Members: Masuda Yuuri (vocalist), [Segawa Mototaka](https://anilist.co/staff/153288/Mototaka-Segawa) (rapper), and [Kimura Takashi](https://anilist.co/staff/347625/) (producer).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/xexex36) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshihiro_watanabe1971/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡邊義弘_(アニメーター%29)

An animator, character designer and adult game artist.

_Not to be confused with the producer [of the same name.](https://anilist.co/staff/233840)_
Originating from Green Box.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujimari_617) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤田まり子)

A Japanese animator and designer.
Mitsuharu Miyamae is an art director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/o3x) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/o3x/) | [Website](http://www.gernika.jp/staff/o3x/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/o3x/)

Dave Rodgers is an Italian songwriter, composer, and producer.

Dave Rodgers, considered by many as the "father of Eurobeat", wrote and produced over 2500 songs for many famous artists, like the J-POP singer [Namie Amuro](https://anilist.co/staff/101167/Namie-Amuro) ( Try Me, Watashi Shinjite), [V6](https://anilist.co/staff/168540/V6) ( Ultraman Tiga, Take me higher), [Max](https://anilist.co/staff/285959/MAX) and many others.

A handful of these songs are used in the Initial D anime and video games. He's also apart of the Eurobeat group [The Spiders From Mars](https://anilist.co/staff/277077/The-Spiders-From-Mars). He was married to [Alessandra Mirka Gatti](https://anilist.co/staff/321715) with whom he had one son, [Federico Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/321713).

name.native: エヴリ・リトル・シング

node.description: **Every Little Thing** is a Japanese pop rock duo consisting of **Kaori Mochida** and **Ichiro Ito** who debuted in August 1996.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ennio.zanini/)

Born in Dezenzano, Terence Trent D'Arby inspired him to become a guitar player and singer. After many auditions, he made his debut as the lead singer of the New Wave group "Current Affairs".

He makes use of his 3 octave range and runs around clubs and discos all over Italy, performing his energetic non-stop tour performances. His activities gradually became known to the music industry.

While releasing several CDs with the group, he met [Stefano Castagna](https://anilist.co/staff/302393/Stefano-Castagna) and began his training as a Eurobeat singer. Furthermore, his cultivated ability became the driving force to create completely new melodies and arrangements, and "Fastway" was born.

He's also a member of the Eurobeat duo [Go 2](https://anilist.co/staff/277287/Go-2) along with [Christian Codenotti](https://anilist.co/staff/277277/Christian-Codenotti).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤和巳)

Originating from Studio Giants' in-between department, Studio Lions.
Storyboards and directs on occasions.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/影山楙倫)

Originating from Ashi Productions.
Katsumata Ryuuichi is a music composer and arranger. He was also keyboarder in the band Kome Kome Club (米米CLUB).
Long-time veteran affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

Shuuichi Kakesu was born 1957 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan. He is a graduate student of Japan Academy of Moving Images and the founder and current representative director of editing studio Jay Film.

He started working at editing studio Okayasu Promotion, where he studied under Okayasu Hajime himself. In 1990 he founded Jay Film; or reorganised Kakesu Henshuushitsu, an editing studio he founded previously, into Jay Film. He was the first to introduce the non-linear editing system in Japan in 1994.

Kakesu won an Association of Media in Digital Award in 1996.
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/239279/) or the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/239278/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/戸田博史_(脚本家%29)

Waseda University graduate.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/外崎春雄)

Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
He is a scriptwriter and novelist.
